humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a tumor size of 4 x 0 x 5.5 cm, which is more than 5 cm. According to the rules provided, this corresponds to a T3 tumor. The histological type of metaplastic carcinoma, the absence of venous invasion, and the uninvolved margins do not affect the T stage determination. The negative ER/PR/Her-2/neu reactions and Ki-67 index also do not impact the T stage.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the tumor size is described as 4 x 0 x 5.5 cm. According to the TNM staging system, a T3 stage is assigned when the tumor size is more than 5 cm. Therefore, the patient's cancer stage is T3.
